reviews.text: The d�cor was simple and elegant.
Been coming here for years. Delish

We hosted our grandson's Sheva Brachot dinner here.  Food was creative, tasty and well presented.  Staff was courteous and helpful, creating a successful dinner.  We look forward to hosting another Sheva Brachot dinner for our family and friends.  Thanks, Corner Cafe, for your quality service.
Fantastic Houlimi Salads were the hit of the BBQ!
The food is excellent. The baked goods are amazing. The service is so bad it’s laughable.
Prompt service and excellent bakery items
אחלה מקום!!
Pretty cool

Delicious breakfast food and I loved the heated terrace. So sunny and airy but still warm. Service was top notch!
I really appreciated that breakfast mains included coffee AND bread - and no upcharge for GF toast!

My receipt says I dealt with Miguel A, who had a poor attitude for someone dealing with customers.  He didn't respond when I greeted him as I entered, and throughout the brief interaction the vibe was as if he was doing me a favor of some sort.

They lost a potential repeat customer today, regardless of how good the cake might be!

Great service very good price. If you order a pasta comes with soup or salad, and they bring you a bread basket.
Nice place. Very cozy.
Would definitely come back if in Riversidale.

Sorry for the picture. I forgot to take it before, lol. It's the funghi pasta, but I changed to fettuccine.
Delicious desserts!
Nice service, not russhed, gave sec@rakq

Love the fresh bread that comes with the soup of the day (I’ve tried the gazpacho and the lentil soup and recommend both!)
Enjoyed the strawberry banana smoothie

I custom ordered the tart for the Birthday girl and she loved it. Really delicious and definitely beautiful. The berries tasted good and fresh. The tart was simply delicious. The staff were friendly and helpful. Thank you
No parking
Mal servicio , no lo recomiendo .
I did not visit this restaurant recently
Mostly run by Hispanic which is good for me but not for everyone

The last several times that I ordered pizza in this store, the slice was kept in the oven for only 1 minute.  I never had pizza cooked in so short a time.  One time I was told that they don't want to heat it at all since it will get cold again when I get home and I will lose the oils If I needed to reheat it.  I explained that is no problem, I like it heated in the special pizza oven. Usually, when I order pizza I need to wait about 5 minutes but I can't understand why they are skimping on the oven now. They said their oven is much hotter so it will burn. Since it is a pizza store, shouldn't the oven be kept at the proper temperature for heating pizza? I don't understand why they would treat their customers this way.  It's a shame because since I don't drive, this is the store that I would need to patronize.
Nice
Could not find anything tasty
I had a perfectly respectable halloumi salad from here.  Would go again if i was in the neighborhood.
Not safe for celiacs - items on menu marked gluten free aren’t not actually gluten free.

My tuna scallopini! Baking goods!
Lots of option on the menu!
Great kosher food!
Completely lovely. The sandwiches are delicious and there's chill music and lots of beautiful baked goods at the counter. Really refreshing iced coffee too. Will definitely be coming back.

Amazing food and nice portion sizes. Love the spinach crepes - like savory blintzes, and the potato and vegetable latkes with sour creme. Really nice balance of flavors without being heavy or greasy. For delivery they also package it with seals for keeping it kosher. Highly recommend.

מקום קסום וטעים, המנות מפנקות וגדולות
בעלת הבית מדהימה!
Great food. GREAT baked goods!

We had a delicious lunch at the Corner Cafe & Bakery! I had their Shakshuka  and my guest had their Spanish omelette, however we could have had pasta, pizza, lasagna and all kinds of salads . And their desserts looked fabulous!
Increíble repostería típica judía, sabores únicos, muy buenos precios

The food is amazing like grandma cooking, price is totally worth it!!! Thanks to all the minorities working there so hard I truly salute and appreciate your work! Not all of the staff there is rude but most of them are. The worse is the…
Excellent food. Very tasty
Love the atmosphere. Food is kosher and fairly good. All dairy place. Kinda pricey for the quality.
Thank you to the corner cafe for catering an amazing party today. Everything was both delicious and beautiful. Thank you Cochava- you are amazing!

We enjoyed a delicious meal at Corner Cafe & Bakery in the Riverdale section of the Bronx, NY. The back outside patio has heating lamps so it was a very warm atmosphere. Quick service too. Pictured :
Funghi
Bolognese
Homemade Mozzarella Sticks

(Not pictured are delicious vegetable soups that came with the entrees)
Very good food nice outdoor seating would definitely go again
I dream about the bread rolls and pasta. My favorite is the pasta primavera. A great food find
Reliable. Clean.

Amaaaaaaaaaaazing. It is literally the best food ever. Everything they have is so delicious. They have really good pizza, High quality fish, and incredible desserts. They also have heavenly dinner rolls

Very good for what it is - nothing fancy, just basic diner-like kosher food. Lots of options for breakfast. Particularly notable is there high level of gluten/diet awareness and availability of gluten free options. Recommend, especially for anyone needing GF
Food was good. Small portions for the price, unless you get pizza.
Tasty pizza
The definitive Riverdale breakfast spot, without question. Friendly and warm staff, great menu and wonderful baked goods.
Great place for breakfast, lunch or a light dinner...and those fresh baked babkas...save room.

I really want to like this place. The service was so painfully slow and Nonexistent that I cannot come back here. The young Waitress complained loudly and was very vocal about her unhappiness with working there and how there needs to be…

Food is VERY, very good. Just about everything is very tasty, large portions. Meditteranean salmon is beyond excellent. Delivery is reliable. Giving it five stars as a "family" restaurant. Decor is nice, however it is not fancy, fancy. If comparing to fancy restaurants, I would give it four stars.

Food has improved a lot since we had been there a year ago. The menu is better and everyone at the table enjoyed their food. However, the service was slow and that's why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. Very good experience overall.
Love this place. My kids - teenagers - did too. Comfort food at comfortable prices. Very tasty and fairly priced. Quick service. Pasta Alfredo was a hit, and the desserts are lovely.

Fantastic bakery items including afew gluten-free!  A GREAT chocolate cake with chocolate icing that people drive many miles out-of-the -way to buy!!! GREAT meals to go including delicious grilled salom over greens.  Their breakfast menu is delightful as well ... served until 3pm.

Great food. Especially when Kochava is there. Deserts and cakes are truly amazing.  NYC prices, but then again someone’s gotta pay for that unnecessary Hasgacha. Restaurant seating is tight. But outside summer seating helps that situation.…

I’m not quite sure what to make of this place. On a good day I would probably give it three stars. There is nothing exceptional about it, either pro or con. It’s a kosher dairy restaurant and bakery, the food is fair, the ambience is acceptable and the service is decent. However, on my most recent visit there, it wasn’t a good day. While perusing the menu, I was excited to see the “Impossible Burger” as one of the choices. Wow! The “Impossible Burger” is very popular right now and sometimes it’s harder to find than a Willy Wonka chocolate bar with the “Golden Ticket,” especially in a kosher restaurant. And yet, here it was! I happily ordered it but became immediately suspicious when the waiter brought it over. I had to literally search for the patty. As in hide and seek. Any of you who have had a real “Impossible Burger,” as I have, know that the patty is HUGE. And it really does taste like meat. It’s delightfully perverse in a way. This burger’s patty was minuscule and my guess is that it was a generic vegetarian patty. And it certainly didn’t taste like the real thing because it clearly wasn’t. I turned to the waiter laughing and asked, “Are you sure this is the ‘Impossible Burger?’” He replied (somewhat hesitantly) in the affirmative. I asked another waiter to check with the owner. The owner couldn’t be found (it’s not a very big restaurant). Perhaps the owner thought that “Impossible Burger” is to veggie patty what “Kleenex” is to tissue: a genericized trademark. All I know is I paid close to twenty dollars for a generic veggie burger. Impossible, you say? Very possible. And unfortunate.

I don't usually do this , but giving the circumstances I feel people need to know about the horrible experience I  I had at this place.  I started going to this place about a year ago maybe 3 to 4 times, I would always get their desserts  but the last two times I went I was really hooked on the Mediterranean Salad, which is ok am a caregiver for twins and  vegetarian and find it sometimes difficult to find food that has no meat or on the go. My last visit to this place was horrific, I went there  with my twins, while I was standing waiting on my order to be done on a side because the place is really narrow. I was told by an senior lady who work at the counter to GET OUT. I was shocked to hear this and I didn't know or couldn't understand what just happened.  Mind  you my kids are in a stroller. Why was I  told to get out-- can you guess?  Because the color of my (Brown)skin?  She told me again to get  out that I was in the way; but I wasn't--I was on a side. A Latin gentleman who work behind the counter came to my defense and asked  her how could I leave when I'm waiting  for  food? At the end the gentleman apologize for her rude behavior.They were others customers in the same area with whom she had no problem. I refrained from responding rudely  to this old lady but this experience caught me by surprise and left me feeling sad.
I came here with my wife, and had a wonderful time dining on the outdoor patio. It was a chilly day, but the heaters kept the patio warm and the food was delicious.
Great food and nice variety. Enjoyed a delicious lunch with my kids. Service quick and exceptional.
Fresh and taste food. The only problem with this place is the service. They seem unfriendly and uptight. The food also takes excessively long to receive.
The penne with vodka sauce and winter soup were delicious. Especially with the fresh bread. Yummy!
Been going here for years -- for coffee, breakfast, lunch and dinner.  In the summer there's an outdoor deck for customers to enjoy. Really great place.
It is amazing food, great atmosphere, nice and fast service. All around good
Plain storefront hides the fact that the food is phenomenal-don't miss the latkes! The pastries I brought home were delicious...
Service was prompt, food was good, servers were nice. All in all, a nice place for a calm, midday lunch.
We love this place, yummy food, great atmosphere and absolutely amazing cakes and pastries
Great food, great service, and don't get me started on their deserts. When will you open in California?
They have great cakes. They are very professional with there food, I would definitely recommend trying.
Great customer service.  Fresh baked goods.  You can order for same day pickup.
Good food but skimpy portions and very expensive for what you get. It took 20 minutes for 4 bagels with cream cheese
Food was wonderful.  Reasonably priced.  Keep up the good work.
